abstract: A merger boom last year has set the stage for a string of big bond transactions in 2016 as companies finance those purchases.
snippet: A merger boom last year has set the stage for a string of big bond transactions in 2016 as companies finance those purchases.
lead_paragraph: Anheuser-Busch InBev has completed a $46 billion, seven-part bond deal to help finance its acquisition of a fellow brewing company, SABMiller, in the second-largest corporate debt offering ever in the United States, according to Thomson Reuters.

headline.main: Anheuser-Busch InBev Sets $46 Billion Bond Sale
headline.print_headline: Beer Giant Completes $46 Billion Bond Deal
